question_text: Select two reasons why virtualizing legacy applications may be preferred over using modern compatibility layers.
answer_options: Virtual machines ensure isolation from host system vulnerabilities
Legacy applications often lack user interfaces on modern systems
Snapshots reduce the need for antivirus tools
The legacy OS environment can be exactly replicated and preserved
correct_answer: Virtual machines ensure isolation from host system vulnerabilities
The legacy OS environment can be exactly replicated and preserved
explanation: VMs provide both security and fidelity. Running legacy OSes directly avoids instability introduced by translation layers or compatibility hacks.
